nodes.bodyText:
Suggested update for

The path of the keytab file used to obtain the principal's secret key. If unspecified, the keytab from the Kerberos configuration file will be used. If it is not specified in the Kerberos configuration file then it will look for the file at {user.home}/krb5.keytab.

to

The path of the keytab file that is used to obtain the principal's secret key. If unspecified, the keytab from the Kerberos configuration file is used. If it is not specified in the Kerberos configuration file, then it looks for the file at {user.home}/krb5.keytab.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -32,3 +32,12 @@ enabled.desc=Enables the authentication data subject cache.
 
 maxSize=Maximum cache size
 maxSize.desc=Maximum number of entries supported by the authentication data subject cache.
+
+#======= KERBEROS SETTINGS =========
+krb5Principal=Kerberos principal name
+krb5Principal.desc=The name of the principal that should be used. The principal can be a simple username or a service name.
+
+krb5Keytab=Kerberos keytab file
+krb5Keytab.desc=The path of the keytab file used to obtain the principal's secret key. If unspecified, the keytab from the \
+Kerberos configuration file will be used. If it is not specified in the Kerberos configuration file then it will look for the \
+file at {user.home}/krb5.keytab.

nodes.bodyText: service name should change to service principal name (SPN).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -32,3 +32,14 @@ enabled.desc=Enables the authentication data subject cache.
 
 maxSize=Maximum cache size
 maxSize.desc=Maximum number of entries supported by the authentication data subject cache.
+
+#======= KERBEROS SETTINGS =========
+# Do not translate: Kerberos, principal
+krb5Principal=Kerberos principal name
+krb5Principal.desc=The name of the principal to be used. The principal can be a simple username or a service name.

nodes.bodyText: @utle the goal of this code block is to ensure that a GSSCredential is associated with the Subject after the method exits, because the JDBC code expects to find a GSSCredential on the subject later on. To accomplish this, first I needed to check if there was already a GSSCred on the subject, and if it's not already there, then we do call SubjectHelper.getGSSCredentialFromSubject(subject); on line 200 and add that GSSCredential to the subject.

If you specify the default location and name, then we need a complete list of OS .
Do we plan to support variable name?

nodes.bodyText: I checked in the JDK code, and the Login Module checks the Java System property user.home and user.dir regardless of OS.
